skill.name: format-standardize
skill.description: Standardize formatting and apply consistent style to the deliverable. Use after generation to ensure the output matches the user's formatting standards and conventions.
skill.summary: Standardize formatting and apply consistent style to the deliverable. Use after generation to ensure...
skill.author: AbeJitsu

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation with formatting instructions. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or file system access. The skill provides guidance to AI assistants on how to standardize output formatting.

content.user_title: Standardize formatting and apply consistent style
content.value_statement: AI-generated deliverables often have inconsistent formatting that reduces professionalism. This skill applies uniform formatting rules, naming conventions, and style standards to make any output look production-ready.
actual_capabilities: Apply consistent code formatting (indentation, spacing, naming conventions)
Standardize documentation formatting (headers, lists, code blocks)
Load and apply user-defined formatting preferences from standards
Enforce professional appearance across all deliverables
Format code using linters and formatters (ESLint, Prettier, etc.)
limitations: Does not execute formatters directly; provides instructions for AI to follow
Requires StandardsRepository to access user formatting preferences
Does not modify files on disk; works with AI-generated content in memory

use_cases.title: Code Formatting Standards
use_cases.description: Apply consistent indentation, naming conventions, and spacing rules to AI-generated code

use_cases.title: Documentation Formatting
use_cases.description: Standardize markdown formatting, headers, lists, and code blocks in generated docs

use_cases.title: Deliverable Polish
use_cases.description: Ensure all AI-generated outputs meet team style guidelines before delivery

prompt_templates.title: Quick Format
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply consistent formatting to this deliverable using standard conventions. Check indentation, spacing, and naming consistency.

prompt_templates.title: Load Standards
prompt_templates.prompt: Load the project standards and apply the user's formatting preferences. Use their linter and formatter conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Documentation Style
prompt_templates.prompt: Format this documentation with consistent header levels, list styles, code block formatting, and professional appearance.

prompt_templates.title: Full Standardization
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform complete standardization: check code formatting, documentation style, naming conventions, spacing rules, and ensure production-ready consistency throughout.

output_examples.input: Format this JavaScript code to match our team standards

best_practices: Define formatting standards upfront in your project configuration
Use consistent tools across your codebase (ESLint, Prettier, Black)
Apply formatting as a final step before delivery or code review
anti_patterns: Mixing spaces and tabs in the same file
Leaving inconsistent spacing around operators and braces
Skipping formatting checks when rushing to deliver
Applying different formatting rules to different files in the same project

faq.question: What tools does this skill use for formatting?
faq.answer: The skill references ESLint, Prettier, and other formatters as recommendations. The actual AI follows the rules directly in its output.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my existing files?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides formatting guidance for AI-generated content. It does not execute file modifications directly.

faq.question: How are formatting preferences stored?
faq.answer: Preferences are loaded from StandardsRepository which reads project configuration and commonPatterns settings.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution, network access, or file I/O beyond reading its own instructions.

faq.question: What file types can be formatted?
faq.answer: The skill applies to code (JavaScript, Python, etc.), documentation (Markdown), and content creation in general.

faq.question: How does this differ from Prettier or ESLint?
faq.answer: This skill guides AI output formatting. Prettier and ESLint are CLI tools that format files directly. Use both together for best results.
